properties.notes: sold - Property held in bare trust (nominee arrangement) where beneficiary (John) is absolutely entitled. Property was John's main residence entire time. Legal title in trustee's name but John is beneficial owner.

user_query: My property is held in a bare trust where I'm the sole beneficiary with absolute entitlement. The trustee is selling it but I've lived in it as my home since purchase. Do I get the main residence exemption even though I don't hold legal title?
